examples: he returned to the comparative comfort of his own home

adjective.description: Of or involving comparison between two or more branches of science or subjects of study.
(of an adjective or adverb) expressing a higher degree of a quality, but not the highest possible (e.g. braver; more fiercely).

origin: Late Middle English (in comparative (sense 3 of the adjective)): from Latin comparativus, from comparare to pair, match (see compare).
